title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: WTE plants, waste segregation part of long-term pollution plan for Delhi
Rising component costs may force cos to pull plug on entry-level 5G phones
SK Hynix looks for local partner to set up memory assembly unit in India
Tejas refutes Airtel: interference from near BSNL sites
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- Tejas Networks refuted *Airtel*'s claims, saying interference stems from sites deployed very close to *BSNL* network, raising the *noise floor*. 
- A Tejas executive stated the issue is proximity to BSNL, not Tejas radios' emissions, and that the radios meet **3GPP/TEC specs**. 
- The letter notes *BSNL* has deployed antennas with built‑in filters at many sites and urges *Airtel* to work with *BSNL* to install filters at additional sites.

items.title: Stallion India Fluorochemicals reaffirms FY26 revenue growth guidance of 30–35%
Indore SEZ exports jump 32% on pharma orders
items.summary: - Exports from *Indore SEZ* rose 32% to ₹8,127.67 crore in April–October, helped by increased orders from *pharmaceutical units*.\n- About *70%* of exports from *Indore SEZ* are **pharmaceuticals**, with the United States among top importers.\n- The SEZ spans 572 hectares in the *Pithampur Industrial Area*, hosting 59 plants including 22 in **pharma**.

items.title: Zepto Logic signs ₹250-cr pact with TN for chip design
items.author: Ashutosh Kumar, ETTelecom
items.summary:
- Zepto Logic and the Tamil Nadu government signed a *₹250-crore* MoU to set up a fabless chip design house and a *VLSI skilling centre*. 
- The centre will focus on *system-on-chips*, *IP*, *ASICs* and *FPGAs*, with core design services backed by *Caliber Embedded Technologies*. 
- The move aims to build an indigenous *chip design* ecosystem and a long-term semiconductor innovation campus for *R&D*, IP development and downstream manufacturing.

items.title: Rolls-Royce sees India’s private power business overtaking government by 2026-27
Venus Safety & Health hosts NIFT students for industry immersion at PPE manufacturing facility
CII unveils India’s first Engineering Hardware Startup Ecosystem report
Schneider Electric and VIT launch CoE at Vellore
items.summary:
- The collaboration between **Schneider Electric** and **Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT)** will establish a **Centre of Excellence (CoE)** in **Smart City** and **Smart Factory Technologies** at VIT's campus to boost research, innovation, and skill development.
- The first batch will onboard 1,100 students, leveraging VIT’s status as the first Indian university empanelled as a **Schneider Electric Priority Campus** globally.
- The CoE will bridge academia and industry, enabling real-world projects, prototype development, and curriculum integration to prepare students for a digital and sustainable future.

items.title: SMPP-KNDS pact for KATANA artillery ammo
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - SMPP and KNDS signed a teaming agreement to offer the *KATANA* family to the Indian Army under Make in India.\n- KATANA includes BR, ER and HP 155mm munitions with a *hybrid GNSS-IMU guidance* system and future *semi-active laser* seeker.\n- The pact aligns with the Indian Army's demands for 155mm artillery and expands SMPP's manufacturing footprint in Haryana and Himachal Pradesh.

items.title: New labour codes to trigger major HR overhaul in auto retail: Vinkesh Gulati
India's finished steel imports fall 34% on govt data
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *April–October* finished steel imports fell about **34%** year-on-year to **3.8 million metric tons**.
- India exported **3.5 million metric tons**, up **25.3% YoY**, with Italy and Belgium as top markets.
- Domestic prices stayed under pressure from weak demand as consumption rose to **92.2 MMT** (+**7.4%** YoY), with finished steel production at **91.6 MMT** and crude steel at **95.7 MMT**.

items.title: Elon Musk pitches Tesla's in-house AI chip ambitions
items.summary:
- Musk says Tesla has designed and deployed 'several million *AI chips*' across vehicles and data centers, with *AI4* in cars, *AI5* near tape-out and early *AI6* work, and aims to bring a new *AI chip design* to volume production every 12 months—surpassing all others.
- Tesla opened a direct hiring channel for *AI silicon engineers*, inviting candidates to show exceptional ability to apply cutting-edge *AI techniques* to chip design.
- The push comes as automakers and Big Tech race to build custom silicon for *autonomous driving* and robotics, competing with **Nvidia**; Musk says these chips will boost safety and enable advanced care via Optimus.

items.title: Allcargo expands domestic network to 71 locations
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Allcargo expanded its domestic network from 21 to 71 locations after restructuring, extending reach across *India*. 
- It introduced a four-tier transshipment structure — **Platinum**, **Gold**, **Silver**, and **Bronze** — to improve routing and reduce *turnaround time* in express distribution and *consultative logistics*. 
- The move targets smaller cities and regional markets, leveraging synergies between express and *consultative logistics* to boost efficiency and customer experience.

items.title: HAL says Tejas crash an ‘isolated occurrence’ as defence stocks decline
Local value-add to define India’s manufacturing rise, says Lava’s Sanjeev Agarwal
How Reliance-backed Addverb is powering a new wave of chip demand
Dilip Buildcon as lowest bidder for NALCO Pottangi mine
items.summary:
- Dilip Buildcon Limited (*DBL*) is the **lowest bidder** for NALCO’s ₹5,000 crore Pottangi mine MDO project, including conveyor and water facilities.
- The 25-year project starts with 3 years of **EPC work** worth ₹1,750 crore for the conveyor, covering 7 million tonnes, with 77 million tonnes later.
- DBL’s order book is about ₹18,610 crore as of 30 Sept 2025, with FY26 orders of ₹5,665 crore and a target of ~₹15,000 crore.

items.title: CG Power unit’s Loco Kavach order cancelled due to delays
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- GGT's order from Chittaranjan Locomotive Works for **Loco Kavach** in the Developmental Category was cancelled as deliveries could not start within the 12-month window due to pending approvals (ISA and RDSO).
- ISA and RDSO activities are in their final stages but were not completed in time to commence deliveries.
- GGT will stay qualified for future tenders and hopes to participate in bulk procurement once approvals are secured and Version 4.0 compliance, including the **Uniform Braking Algorithm**, is achieved.

items.title: ACME Solar wins 130 MW RTC auction
items.summary:
- **ACME Solar** won 130 MW in REMCL's RTC tender with a bid of ₹4.35 per unit, signaling strong competition in the e-reverse auction for Indian Railways. 
- The project is to be commissioned within 30 months after signing the PPA, leveraging land and connectivity in ACME's existing portfolio. 
- The bid requires firm supply via dispatchable storage (or wind) to meet 75% availability for 3 years and 85% thereafter, integrating **energy storage** to ensure reliability.

items.title: Tejas crash dampens export hopes for Indian fighter jet
Magna to produce China's GAC electric vehicles in Europe
items.summary:
- *GAC* will manufacture its **AION V** electric SUV at Magna's Graz, Austria plant, using shared lines.
- This move helps **GAC** sidestep EU tariffs on China-made EVs by localising production in Europe.
- **Magna Steyr**'s capabilities and the earlier plan to build XPeng models at the same facility point to a broader move toward local EV manufacturing in Europe.

items.title: Rolls-Royce sees India’s private power business overtaking government by 2026-27
US mulls Nvidia selling H200 chips to China, sources say
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is weighing allowing Nvidia's *H200* **AI chips** to be sold to *China*, signaling a potential easing of export controls.
- The Commerce Department is reviewing policy while a White House official declined to comment, citing national security and tech leadership concerns.
- Observers say the move could ease US-China tensions but hawks warn shipments could empower Beijing's military and tech sectors under export **controls**.

items.title: Nokia plans to invest $4B in US for R&D and manufacturing
items.summary:
- Nokia said it will invest $4 billion in the United States, with major focus on *R&D* and manufacturing to boost **AI-driven** network connectivity.
- About $3.5 billion is earmarked for *R&D*, and $500 million for manufacturing and capex in states like *Texas*, *New Jersey*, and **Pennsylvania**.
- The move follows a July profit warning linked to tariffs and a weaker dollar, as Nokia emphasizes a strategy of **Western technology** and streamlining operations with *AI*.

items.title: Eli Lilly becomes first drugmaker to hit $1 trillion valuation on weight-loss demand
Straw can generate ₹270 cr energy yearly: IBA
items.summary:
- Diverting 7.3 million tonnes of paddy straw from burning to biogas can yield renewable gas worth about ₹270 crore annually.
- The Indian Biogas Association says anaerobic digestion can convert straw into **Compressed Bio-Gas (CBG)** that can directly replace imported natural gas, boosting energy security.
- The policy could attract about **₹37,500 crore** and support 750 CBG projects by 2028–29, while unlocking bioethanol potential and aiming for 1% Sustainable Aviation Fuel blending by 2027.

items.title: Arunachal seeks GI tag for 10 agro products
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Arunachal Pradesh seeks *Geographical Indication* (GI) for 10 agro products, including *Bagra pineapple*, *Pasighat jaggery*, and *Baali* (rice).
- Names like Idu Yamba, Angpu, Mipun rice, Libi Balangbu, Bebo, cinnamon and Andoye are among the filings; **20 more** are in the pipeline.
- GI registrations include Wakro Orange, Adi Kekir ginger, Khaw Tai rice, Yak Churpi and Singpho Phalap tea, aiming to protect heritage and benefit farmers.

items.title: Magna to produce China's GAC electric vehicles in Europe
items.summary:
- GAC will build its *AION V* electric model at Magna's *Graz, Austria* facility to sidestep *EU tariffs* on China-made EVs.
- Magna's plant will enable *localizing production* for GAC and other brands, following a plan to build battery-powered models for *XPeng* at the same site.
- *Europe* is described as a vital market by *GAC International*'s Wei Haigang, highlighting the strategic nature of the deal.

items.title: From satellites to megastructures: Building the next stage of economic growth in space
BirlaNu to set up ₹127 crore fibre cement plant in Andhra
items.summary:
- BirlaNu will invest around ₹127 crore to establish the first phase of a *fibre cement board* plant in *Nellore*, *Andhra Pradesh*, expanding its manufacturing footprint.
- The facility will use fly ash from coal-based plants, promoting a *circular economy* by reducing waste and landfill needs.
- The first phase is expected to create about *600 direct and indirect jobs*, with a second phase for *PVC pipes*, fittings and construction chemicals at the site.

items.title: India mulls floating global tenders for key patented drugs
items.summary:
- The government is weighing *global tenders* to procure dozens of **patented drugs** — including semaglutide, tirzepatide and evolocumab — for central health bodies such as the armed forces medical wing and ESIS. 
- The Department of Pharmaceuticals has added over 65 **patented drugs** to a potential *GTE exemption* list, inviting objections from local manufacturers by December 5. 
- Deliberations among the DoP, health and finance ministries are ongoing, with a final notification by the Department of Expenditure expected thereafter.

items.title: US manufacturing slows in November as high prices curb demand
AstraZeneca to invest $2B in US manufacturing push
items.summary: - *AstraZeneca* will invest **$2 billion** to expand its US footprint, creating about 2,600 jobs in Maryland.\n- The plan includes a new clinical manufacturing facility in *Gaithersburg* and a biologics site at *Frederick*.\n- It forms part of a broader effort to boost domestic drug production and U.S. manufacturing jobs.

items.title: Foxconn can make 1,000 AI racks weekly – up next year
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Foxconn can manufacture *1,000 AI racks per week* and expects the rate to rise next year.
- Liu said **$2–3 billion annually** will be invested in *AI*, boosting its AI rack and data-center business.
- Visionbay.ai's Neo Yao said it planned to deploy a *27-megawatt* data centre containing **Nvidia GB300** chips in the first half of *2026*, Asia's first GB300 AI data centre.

items.title: India’s EV market still dependent on Chinese imports; only 13% models qualify for PLI benefits
Railways cross 1,020 MT freight; daily 4.4 MT
items.summary:
- The Indian Railways crossed **1,020 MT** of cumulative freight loading as of 19 November 2025, with daily loading around **4.4 MT**, underscoring its role in supporting India's industrial growth.
- Coal remains the largest contributor at **505 MT**, followed by iron ore (**115 MT**), cement (**92 MT**), container traffic (**59 MT**), and other sectors, signaling broad-based demand.
- Reforms like the **Policy for Bulk Cement Terminals** and reduced-rate bulk cement in containers aim to boost bulk handling, shorten transit times, cut logistics costs, lower carbon footprints, and align with **Net Zero** targets.

items.title: CAG auditing reforms by states to improve ease of doing biz for MSMEs
Minimum import price for APIs to hit small pharma
items.author: Teena Thacker, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The government is weighing minimum import prices for Penicillin-G, 6APA and amoxicillin, potentially raising *API* and medicine costs.
- Over 10,000 *MSMEs* could be affected, risking about 200,000 jobs.
- Experts see it as a push toward *self-reliance* amid *China*’s dominance, though critics say *PLI* wasn’t meant to regulate these prices.

items.title: Tech, electronics firms back codes, but worry about costs
New labour codes: What they mean for workers and businesses
items.summary:
- The four codes unify *wages*, *industrial relations*, *social security* and *safety* under one framework, extending social protection to *gig workers*.
- Small firms gain flexibility as layoffs threshold rises to 300, with daily hours capped at 8–12 and **double overtime**.
- Other reforms include a **wage floor**, **26 weeks of maternity leave**, night work safeguards, formal employment letters, and a five-year nationwide contractor license.

items.title: UK to levy $655 million of new tariffs on low-value imports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Reeves** plans to remove the tariff exemption for *low-value imports* costing under £135, aiming to raise about £500 million annually. 
- The government says any impact on *consumer prices* will be modest, while critics warn it could affect online shoppers and aid **British retailers**. 
- The move echoes actions in the US and EU to close loopholes on cross-border shopping.

items.title: From dependence to dominance: India’s next test in solar manufacturing
MoS suspends QCO enforcement on 42+13 steel standards
items.summary:
- The *Ministry of Steel* suspended enforcement of the **Quality Control Order (QCO)** on 42 Indian Standards for three years to keep downstream availability.
- Enforcement on 13 *speciality steel standards* was suspended for one year to balance pricing, imports, and support for *MSMEs* and domestic self-reliance.
- The changes were issued via the **Steel and Steel Products (Quality Control) Amendment Order, 2025**.

items.title: Delhi govt to begin annual survey of industries to assess manufacturing sector growth
AstraZeneca to invest $2 billion as part of US manufacturing push
items.summary:
- **AstraZeneca** will invest $2 billion to boost **US manufacturing** and build a new clinical manufacturing facility in **Gaithersburg, MD** that will be operational by 2029.
- The **Gaithersburg** facility will create 100 new jobs, retain 400 roles and support about 1,000 construction jobs.
- Earlier announcements include a **Rockville, Maryland** cell therapy facility, a **Virginia** drug substance facility, and the expansion of the **Coppell, Texas** site as part of the US manufacturing push.

items.title: Servotech wins ₹16.31-cr REMCL solar order
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **Servotech Renewable Power System** won a contract worth **₹16.31 crore** from **REMCL** to design, supply and commission solar power systems at the Dedicated Freight Corridor complex in **Noida**.
- The scope includes **ground-mounted** and **rooftop on-grid solar plants** with a **12-month** timeline, and the order carries no related-party transactions.
- **REMCL** is a JV between **RITES** and the Ministry of Railways, underscoring growing railway-linked clean-energy projects.

items.title: World's biggest nuclear plant edges closer to restart
